name: Community requirements misunderstood or miscommunicated
description: Repository is incapable of determining the expectations of its stakeholder communities and therefore unable to tailor business activities appropriately.
notes:
- Does the repository have mechanisms established to monitor the community's knowledge base, requirements or expectations?
- Are community members consulted about the adequacy of available service levels? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes: - Repository fails to identify that its user communities require data to be delivered encoded as .abc files in order for them to be usable
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Establish appropriate technical mechanisms to facilitate monitoring of requirements, expectations and knowledge base of user community In the event of riskâ€™s execution:
- Maintain dialogue with community to ensure the continued correctness of understandability definition
- Maintain flexibility within operational objectives to react to misunderstanding of requirements
